body_html:
I don't think sizes can be either torch.Size or an iterable: expand method accepts positional arguments (*sizes), so technically sizes is always a tuple. This tuple can either contain a single element (torch.Size instance), or several int arguments (size values); this is documented later:

*sizes (torch.Size or int...): The desired expanded size
body_text:
I don't think sizes can be either torch.Size or an iterable: expand method accepts positional arguments (*sizes), so technically sizes is always a tuple. This tuple can either contain a single element (torch.Size instance), or several int arguments (size values); this is documented later:

*sizes (torch.Size or int...): The desired expanded size
body:
I don't think `sizes` can be either `torch.Size` or an iterable: `expand` method accepts positional arguments (`*sizes`), so technically `sizes` is always a tuple. This tuple can either contain a single element (`torch.Size` instance), or several `int` arguments (size values); this is documented later:

> *sizes (torch.Size or int...): The desired expanded size
